title: Edgar Allan Poe National Historic Site: Be A Junior Ranger
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth     Be A Junior Ranger              Be A Junior Ranger       Children visiting the Edgar Allan Poe National Historic Site can become a Junior Ranger by completing the activities in the Junior Ranger Activity Book, geared to children ages five through seven.  The booklet can can also be downloaded from this website.  Participants who attend at least one ranger program and complete five activities will earn a Junior Ranger badge.  Activities are related to locations throughout the site and include word scrambles, dot-to-dot, bingo, matching and more.    It takes a lot to preserve and protect America's natural and historic treasures. We need your help to keep our parks safe and beautiful. Become a National Park Service WebRanger and see just how much fun learning can be!
